meanings.definition: To make something become curled or wavy.
meanings.sent1: She crisped her hair for the party, giving it a stylish wave.
meanings.sent2: The leaves crisped in the autumn breeze, creating a beautiful rustling sound.
meanings.sent3: The chef crisped the potato chips just right, making them irresistible.
meanings.sent4: The edges of the paper crisped under the heat of the lamp, adding a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent5: The sun crisped the edges of the clouds, painting the sky with golden hues.

meanings.definition: To cook something until it is slightly burnt.
meanings.sent1: She crisped the toast to perfection, making it crunchy and delicious.
meanings.sent2: The chef crisped the bacon just enough to give it a smoky flavor.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally crisped the marshmallows over the campfire, turning them into charcoal.
meanings.sent4: The cook crisped the top of the creme brulee, creating a caramelized crust.
meanings.sent5: The baker crisped the crust of the pie, adding a delightful crunch to each bite.

meanings.definition: Having a slightly burnt or curled appearance.
meanings.sent1: The crisped edges of the paper gave it an antique look.
meanings.sent2: The crisped leaves on the tree signaled the arrival of autumn.
meanings.sent3: The crisped edges of the toast added a rustic charm to the breakfast table.
meanings.sent4: Her crisped hair strands framed her face beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The crisped edges of the cookie provided a satisfying crunch with each bite.
